comments.body: Specify that this helper creates nodes within a set of different zones.
Alternatively, make the function name unrelated to EvenPodSpread. Something like: `MakeNodesAndPodsInZones`
But it relies on the input pod's `pod.Spec.TopologySpreadConstraints` to construct the workload. Would you mind putting the refactoring in another PR?

I'm fine with keeping the name as is. Just explain what the expected state of the nodes/pods is.

Having a separate PR is fine too.
Specify what are the characteristics of the pods or nodes.
named returned variables are hard to track when the function is that long, I think the golang recommendation is to use them only in very short functions.
